title: The Hobbit
summary: A fantasy adventure about a reluctant hobbit who joins a quest to reclaim a lost treasure. Themes: courage, friendship, magic.
full_summary: Bilbo Baggins, a peaceful hobbit, is thrust into an epic quest when the wizard Gandalf and a band of dwarves recruit him to help recover a stolen treasure guarded by the fearsome dragon Smaug. Along the way, Bilbo faces trolls, goblins, and discovers the One Ring. This journey challenges him to grow in courage and self-confidence, forming lasting friendships and reshaping his identity.

summary: A dystopian tale of surveillance, control, and rebellion. Themes: freedom, totalitarianism, truth.
full_summary: George Orwell’s 1984 explores a world dominated by a totalitarian regime where Big Brother monitors all. Winston Smith, a low-ranking member of the ruling Party, secretly dreams of freedom and begins a forbidden romance. As he delves deeper into rebellion, he confronts the terrifying power of the state and the fragility of truth in a world built on lies.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
summary: A story of racial injustice and childhood in the American South. Themes: morality, empathy, justice.
full_summary: Harper Lee’s novel follows Scout Finch, a young girl growing up in a racially divided Southern town. Her father, Atticus, defends a Black man wrongly accused of assaulting a white woman. Through Scout’s eyes, we see the harsh realities of prejudice and the quiet strength it takes to stand for what is right.

title: The Little Prince
summary: A poetic tale of innocence and discovery. Themes: love, loneliness, human nature.
full_summary: A stranded aviator meets a mysterious young prince from another planet. As the Little Prince recounts his travels and the lessons he’s learned, the story unfolds as a meditation on growing up, love, and what truly matters. A timeless philosophical reflection told through a child’s eyes.

title: Brave New World
summary: A future where happiness is engineered and individuality suppressed. Themes: conformity, control, freedom.
full_summary: In Aldous Huxley’s imagined future, humans are mass-produced and conditioned for specific roles. Pleasure and stability replace freedom and truth. Bernard Marx begins to question this world, especially after meeting a 'savage' from outside society. His rebellion challenges the cost of comfort and the meaning of being human.

title: Frankenstein
summary: A scientist creates life, but at a tragic cost. Themes: ambition, creation, isolation.
full_summary: Victor Frankenstein, driven by scientific curiosity, reanimates a corpse—but his creation becomes a monster shunned by society. As the creature seeks understanding and revenge, the story becomes a haunting tale of guilt, responsibility, and the dangers of unchecked ambition.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
summary: A teenager's cynical journey through New York. Themes: alienation, adolescence, identity.
full_summary: Holden Caulfield, expelled from prep school, wanders New York City grappling with loss, loneliness, and the phoniness he sees in the adult world. His internal struggles reflect a longing to protect innocence in a world he feels disconnected from.

title: Animal Farm
summary: An allegorical farm rebellion mirrors political corruption. Themes: power, revolution, inequality.
full_summary: A group of farm animals overthrow their human owner to establish a society based on equality. But the pigs who lead soon become as oppressive as the humans they replaced. Orwell’s novella is a biting critique of revolutions gone wrong.

title: Life of Pi
summary: A boy stranded at sea with a tiger. Themes: survival, faith, storytelling.
full_summary: After a shipwreck, Pi Patel finds himself alone on a lifeboat in the Pacific Ocean with a Bengal tiger named Richard Parker. Their surreal, dangerous journey tests his faith and understanding of reality. The story explores the power of belief and the line between fact and fiction.

title: The Alchemist
summary: A shepherd follows a dream across the desert. Themes: destiny, self-discovery, dreams.
full_summary: Santiago, a young Andalusian shepherd, leaves his home to pursue a recurring dream of treasure near the Egyptian pyramids. His journey introduces him to mystics, challenges, and the idea that personal legends shape our lives. Coelho’s tale is a spiritual exploration of purpose and inner truth.
